test_cases.expected_answer: BOURNVILLE 70% RICH COCOA 75G PRC and BOURNVILLE 70% RICH COCOA RS.150 75G-PRE both of which has a per unit amount of 120.88

test_cases.source: Salesman Wise PARTY Wise Summary 1-04-2025 to 28-11-25.xlsx.

test_cases.question: Compare the sales volume (Quantity) of "CDM 21G RS.20" versus "CDM 23G RS.20". Which product sold more units?
test_cases.expected_answer: CDM 23G RS.20 sold more units (78,302) compared to CDM 21G RS.20 (20,350).
test_cases.source: Salesman Wise Product Summary.xlsx, Rows 97 and 98.

test_cases.question: Identify the Core Values of Marwa Enterprises as listed in their profile.
test_cases.expected_answer: Integrity, Reliability, Customer Focus, Operational Excellence, and Commitment.
test_cases.rationale: The model must extract the list from the 'Core Values' section of the document.
test_cases.source: MARWA ENTERPRISES-Profile.docx, Section: "Core Values".

test_cases.question: How many different bills were generated for "MOOLANS FAMILY MART" (including Margin Free Market) on April 4th, 2025?
test_cases.source: Salesman Wise PARTY Wise Summary 1-04-2025 to 28-11-25.xlsx, Rows 71 and 73.

test_cases.question: According to the "Distributor Supply Chain" analysis provided, which specific table acts as the "Source of Truth" for inventory cost, and who is the "Principal" listed in that table?
test_cases.expected_answer: Table: All Product Purchase Report (referred to as product_purchase in the analysis). Principal: MONDELEZ INDIA FOODS LTD.
test_cases.rationale: Part 1: The 'Source of Truth' Table - Under the section '1. Inbound Logistics (The Buy Side)', the text states: 'Key Relationship: This is the source of truth for inventory cost and availability.' Part 2: The Principal - Found in Header Section (Row 5) of All Product Purchase Report.xlsx: 'Company :MONDELEZ INDIA FOODS LTD'
test_cases.source: User Context ('Inbound Logistics' section) + All Product Purchase Report.xlsx, Header Row 5.

test_cases.question: The Supply Chain analysis mentions a "Distribution Width" metric found in the product_summary table. What is the distribution width (Outlet count) for "BOURNVILLE 70% RS.120"?
test_cases.source: Salesman Wise Product Summary.xlsx, Row 15, Column: Outlet(s).

test_cases.question: How does the "Operating Hours" in the Company Profile constraint the "Outbound Logistics" flow described in the analysis?
test_cases.expected_answer: The 'Outbound Logistics' (Sales/Delivery) are constrained to Monday to Saturday — 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM.
test_cases.rationale: Connecting the Profile document (operational constraints) to the Abstract Supply Chain text (logistics flow).
test_cases.source: MARWA ENTERPRISES-Profile.docx (Operating Hours) + User Context (Outbound Logistics).

test_cases.question: Based on the "Vision Statement" in the profile, which customer segment (Retail vs. Wholesale) appears to be the primary revenue driver in the Salesman Wise PARTY Wise Summary?
test_cases.expected_answer: Wholesale/Supermarkets appear to be the driver (e.g., Moolans Family Mart, Royal Food Court), aligning with the vision to be a "distribution partner... for retail and wholesale partners."
test_cases.rationale: The model must analyze the high-value transactions in the Excel file (e.g., Moolans ~70k, Royal Food Court ~50k) and map them to the "Wholesale/Supermarket" categories mentioned in the Vision Statement.
test_cases.source: Cross-reference MARWA ENTERPRISES-Profile.docx (Vision) and Salesman Wise PARTY Wise Summary... (High-value rows).

test_cases.question: Identify the date with the highest total sales volume in April 2025 by aggregating all bills for that day.
test_cases.rationale: The model must group rows by Date in the Party Summary file, sum the "Amount" column for each date in April, and identify the peak. (04/04 has multiple high-value bills: 70k, 60k, 49k, etc.).
test_cases.source: Salesman Wise PARTY Wise Summary 1-04-2025 to 28-11-25.xlsx, Rows 65-96.

test_cases.question: Analyze the 'Salesman Wise Product Summary' to determine the 'Drop Size Efficiency' for the top-selling product, CDM 23G RS.20. Calculate the average number of units sold per bill (Total QTY / Bills). Does this figure suggest that this item is primarily a 'loose impulse buy' or a 'bulk stock-up' item for retailers?
test_cases.expected_answer: Calculation: 78,302 (QTY) / 3,138 (Bills) ≈ 24.95 units/bill. Since 25 units is close to a standard box/outer size (typically 24 or 30 for chocolates), this suggests retailers are buying in Bulk / Full Outer Packs, not single units.
test_cases.rationale: This questions moves beyond simple retrieval to "derived metrics" (Average Units per Transaction) and requires business context interpretation (Impulse vs. Bulk).
test_cases.source: Salesman Wise Product Summary.xlsx, Row 98 (QTY: 78,302 | Bills: 3,138).

test_cases.question: Analyze the Salesman Wise Product Summary to determine the revenue concentration. Do the top 5 products contribute to more than 20% of the total revenue shown in the first 20 rows?
test_cases.expected_answer: Yes, significantly more. The top 5 products contribute approximately 49.7% of the total revenue generated by the first 20 items. This indicates a high revenue concentration where a quarter of the products drive half of the sales value.
test_cases.rationale: Exploratory analysis of revenue distribution (Pareto principle application). Total Revenue (Rows 1-20): 196,857.76. Top 5 Revenue Contributors: Row 20 (26,104.77), Row 19 (24,175.29), Row 11 (16,646.48), Row 18 (15,980.62), Row 6 (14,981.85). Sum of Top 5: 97,889.01. Percentage: 97,889.01 / 196,857.76 = 49.73%.
test_cases.source: Salesman Wise Product Summary.xlsx, Rows 1-20.

test_cases.question: Based on the purchase frequency of 'Amal Palace Bakery' in April 2025 (orders on 01/04, 08/04, 15/04, 22/04, 29/04), predict the next likely order date and estimate the order value using a simple average of April's orders.
test_cases.expected_answer: Predicted Next Order Date: May 6th, 2025. Estimated Order Value: ₹18,013 (Rounded from 18,012.80).
test_cases.rationale: Time-series pattern recognition (weekly cycle) and simple moving average for value prediction. Pattern: Weekly cycle (every Tuesday). Dates: 01/04/2025 (Tuesday), 08/04/2025 (Tuesday), 15/04/2025 (Tuesday), 22/04/2025 (Tuesday), 29/04/2025 (Tuesday). Next date: 29/04/2025 + 7 days = 06/05/2025. Value calculation: (14,576 + 9,447 + 27,031 + 14,273 + 24,737) / 5 = 90,064 / 5 = 18,012.80.
test_cases.source: Salesman Wise PARTY Wise Summary 1-04-2025 to 28-11-25.xlsx, April rows for Amal Palace.

test_cases.question: Examine the 'All Product Purchase Report'. Group the 'BOURNVILLE' products by chocolate type (Dark/Rich Cocoa vs. Fruit & Nut/Cranberry). Which category has a higher total purchase investment?
test_cases.expected_answer: The Dark / Rich Cocoa category has a higher total purchase investment compared to the Fruit & Nut/Cranberry category. Dark / Rich Cocoa Total: ₹96,008.25. Fruit & Nut / Cranberry Total: ₹74,345.75. Winner: Dark / Rich Cocoa (by a margin of ₹21,662.50).
test_cases.rationale: Categorization and aggregation of data subsets. Dark/Rich Cocoa includes products explicitly named "Rich Cocoa" or "Dark", and products labeled "RC" (abbreviation for "Rich Cocoa"). Fruit & Nut/Cranberry includes all variant bars with inclusions, such as "Fruit & Nut", "Cranberry", and "Rum & Raisin".
test_cases.source: All Product Purchase Report.xlsx, Rows 1-20.

test_cases.question: In the Salesman Wise Product Summary, perform a 'Trade Spend Efficiency Analysis' for the '5STAR' brand portfolio. Identify the Top 3 '5STAR' SKUs based on Total Amt (Revenue). Calculate the 'Promotional Efficiency Ratio' for each of these three products using the formula: Revenue / Discount. Which specific SKU provides the highest return on discount investment, and how many times more efficient is it compared to the #1 top-selling SKU?
test_cases.expected_answer: Top 3 '5STAR' SKUs (by Revenue): 5STAR HTS 151.5G (Revenue: ₹13,529.07), 5STAR HTS 191.9G (Revenue: ₹5,411.62), 5STAR KITTED PACK 108G (Revenue: ₹4,358.35). Efficiency Ratios: HTS 151.5G: ~8.03, HTS 191.9G: ~6.76, KITTED PACK: ~80.00. The "5STAR KITTED PACK" is the most efficient revenue generator. It is approximately 10 times more efficient (80.00 / 8.03 ≈ 9.96) than the top-selling SKU (HTS 151.5G).
test_cases.rationale: Financial optimization analysis. The Kitted Pack brings in the most efficient revenue with minimal trade spend leakage, while HTS 151.5G brings in the most volume but requires heavier discounting.
test_cases.source: Salesman Wise Product Summary.xlsx (Sheet3), Rows 8, 9, & 11 (Sr. No 1, 2, & 4).
